alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 9:52PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL AND CENTRAL HARDING COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM MDT... At 952 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Solano, or 10 miles west of Mosquero, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mosquero and Solano. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County
